primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The couple/believer must fulfill the dual mandate of loving God and neighbor to sustain a Christian life and marriage.

tekstueel_bewijs: Living a Christian life is... demanding
the pledge taken is to treat this neighbor
Christian marriage requires looking beyond this first neighbor

object.identificatie: The fulfillment of the Great Commandment (Love for God/Neighbor)
tekstueel_bewijs: to love the life of your neighbor as though it were your own life

zender.identificatie: Jesus / The Law of the Great Commandment
tekstueel_bewijs: They asked Jesus which of the commandments... is the most important

ontvanger.identificatie: The Neighbor / The World / The Couple
tekstueel_bewijs: that the life of this neighbor may be more deeply joyous
many other neighbors who wait to have their lives loved
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies primarily with the Subject who must perform the love.

tekstueel_bewijs: God is the ultimate neighbor to whom one goes for generosity and forgiveness
helper.rol_van_god: God is a Helper (Adjuvant) to the human Subject's marriage project.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help sought when human resources are exhausted.

tegenstander.identificatie: Romantic Utopianism / Recent Unpleasantness / Human Insufficiency
tekstueel_bewijs: The great threat... is that one imagines one has only this one neighbor
disappointments that we receive and that we enact
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as the 'unpleasantness' of life and the 'unreality' of romanticism, rather than a cosmic power like Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Holy Neighbor' (God) provides forgiveness so the couple can resume their primary task of loving.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: God acts only when the human Subject fails (the 'unpleasantness'), functioning as a repair mechanism for the primary ethical program.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: we turn to that Holy Neighbor

voorbeelden: the pledge taken is to treat this neighbor
to seek to build a private relationship
it is not to a stranger that we turn, but to one with whom we have practiced
we cannot live well without more forgiveness
able to be generous, able to forgive

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). Grace (Pouvoir) is introduced only as a supplement when human strength fails.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (The Command) to ~S1 (The Threat of Utopia) to S2 (The Reality of Failure) to ~S2 (God's Forgiveness) to return to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Tension is resolved by God acting as a 'Holy Neighbor' who refills the couple's tank of generosity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as 'unpleasantness' rather than 'death' or 'enmity with God'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is anthropocentric. The primary actant is the couple; God is relegated to a 'Neighbor' (Helper) who assists the couple in fulfilling their ethical duties. The 'Grammar of Grace' is inverted: we turn to God so that we can do the work.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: one has recourse to that Holy Neighbor... for what we must have to live
it is not to a stranger that we turn, but to one with whom we have practiced neighborliness

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: we cannot live well without more forgiveness... than we ourselves can muster

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon does not use biblical characters as models, but uses the 'Commandment' itself as a model for behavior.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: A theocentric reading would focus on God as the Husband/Neighbor who first loved the unneighborly humanity.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; God is a safety net rather than a Savior.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where man initiates the turning to God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The 'Neighborhood' metaphor is consistently applied, but it flattens the ontological difference between Creator and Creature.
spanning_punten: The claim that we turn to God because we have 'practiced' neighborliness contradicts the need for 'forgiveness' for failing at that very practice.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christian marriage is a process of finding that 'supreme neighbor,' and then many other neighbors.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (unnamed) provides the 'generosity' the couple lacks to finish their task.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'unpleasantness' or 'disappointment'—manageable through 'recourse' to a neighbor.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon casts the couple as the Subject and God as a Helper. This creates a moralistic engine where grace is fuel for human performance.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The couple is the subject of 'loving', 'looking', and 'turning'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject who neighbors us while we were yet 'unneighborly'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'we turn to the Holy Neighbor', use 'The Holy Neighbor has come to us in our unpleasantness to bring us home.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Good Neighbor' in training.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Position the couple as the 'neighbor in need' whom Jesus rescues.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how God's love *enables* love, rather than how the command *demands* it.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Acknowledge the 'death' of the self that marriage requires.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is only 'unpleasant', the Savior is only 'helpful'. If the opponent is 'death', the Savior is 'Life'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish God's neighborliness to us (Soteriology) as the ground for our neighborliness (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The 'Neighborhood' metaphor is rhetorically brilliant, but it needs to be anchored in God's prior action as the Subject of the story to avoid becoming a heavy burden for the newlyweds.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is warm and engaging; actantially, it is a legalistic mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis correctly identifies the Great Commandment, but the narrative structure fails to account for the Gospel context of that commandment.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that God is treated as a 'resource' (Helper) rather than the 'Source' (Sender/Subject).

appendices.notities: The sermon's definition of God as 'Neighbor' effectively lowers God to the same actantial plane as the spouse, risking a loss of transcendence.
